intro: Leucocodon, commonly known as the white dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Leucocodon species are often found in temperate regions of Europe, Asia, and North America.
